data.title: Tressie Boggs Obituary 2021
data.meta_description: Tressie Huff Boggs, 88 of Bledsoe, Ky passed away on Thursday, March 18, 2021 at her home.        Tressie was born October 9, 1932 at Pine Mountain, KY to the late James W. and...
data.text:
Tressie Huff Boggs, 88 of Bledsoe, Ky passed away on Thursday, March 18, 2021 at her home.

Tressie was born October 9, 1932 at Pine Mountain, KY to the late James W. and Elizabeth Napier Huff. She was a Godly woman, true lady in every sense of the word. She loved everyone, never spoke an ill word about anyone. She was of the Holiness faith and member of the Pine Mountain Church of God, she enjoyed reading her Bible, attending Church, gardening, canning, and cooking for her family. If you visited her, you were going to eat.

Besides her parents she was preceded in death by her beloved husband, Richard Boggs; son, Rick Boggs, Grandsons, TJ Boggs and James Boggs; great granddaughter, Hannah Pace; 3 brothers, June, Bill, and Richard Huff; 3 sisters, Pauline Merrill, Martha Sue Middleton, and Etta Bell Boggs.

She is survived by her sons, Tim (Vanessa) Boggs and Tony (Lisa) Boggs; 8 grandchildren, Michelle (Michael) Pacholewski, Jennifer (George) Ledford, Mandy Boggs, Tonya Boggs, Charles Napier, Whitney (Josh) Jacobson, Anthony (Nicole) Boggs, and Jelisa Cress; 8 great grandchildren and 1 great great grandson; sisters, Jane Shell, Nancy Belcher, Goldie Middleton, Dorothy (Bill) Ward; she leaves a host of family and friends who lives she enriched.

Visitation will be 6:00pm - 10:00 pm Saturday (March 20) at the Pine Mountain Church of God.

Funeral services will be conducted at 11:00 am Sunday (March 21) at the Pine Mountain Church of God with Rev. Kermit Creech officiating.

Burial will follow in the Huff Cemetery at Bledsoe, KY. with Bro. Matt Boggs officiating. Pallbearers will be Grandsons and Nephews.

Covid-19 Restrictions of 60% of church capacity, face masks, and social distancing all set by the Governor of Kentucky shall be followed.

Please feel free to leave a condolence, memory, or photo at www.aljfh.com

Anderson-Laws & Jones Funeral Home is honored to be serving the family of Tressie Huff Boggs.
